page.title: 14FARMING.
page.content: Land in the Penketh area is mainly used for crops.Eg:Wheat,Barley,Corn and oil seed rape,the percentages are as follows:Wheat 20%,Barley 14%,Corn 17%,Oil Seed Rape 9% and others 40%.In the Penketh area there are 108 fields and there are 21 farms therefore the average farm in Penketh has 5 fields. In the fields there are many types of animals,such as horses, cows, chickens and geese. Each farm consists of a farmhouse a barn and a few other buildings eg: cattle sheds. Each farm has an average of 5 buildings. The farms are spread thinly over a large area and not clumped together in a small community. The average land area is 685 metres squared per farm. The area taken up by villages and settlements is 4800 metres squared.
